message: Alright, the cron service is launched, and running some test cron jobs on our apps fine - now we need you guys to try it out with, you know, actual tasks.
@andrewgodwin I will shortly, building something that will definately require a cron job
@jdaguilera sounds like overkill for just cron, but i think he's planning on supporting celery
are you doing the cron jobs using celery?
@jdaguilera No, we have a custom cron daemon that injects commands into the already-existing command-running system
It scans the config of apps (which is mirrored into Redis), decodes the timestamps, and injects things at appropriate times
is there any problem with ep.io servers ? I got this... http://d.pr/nGRA
Is that meaning a need to setup another app and upload again , or is going to be available again, or I need to make git push again?
if not, I advise suspending and then resuming the app from the control panel
@jdaguilera It was a temporary issue, it should have resolved itself
is ep.io running in ec2 or rackspace?
@jdaguilera ec2 at the moment, we plan to have a rackspace region at some point
